Title: The Great Gatsby
Description: A story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the adventures of a young wizard.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and its leader, Big Brother.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Description: A romantic novel of manners that follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Description: A novel about the teenage protagonist Holden Caulfield and his struggles with identity and belonging.

Title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Description: The second book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry returns to Hogwarts for his second year.

Title: Animal Farm
Description: A satirical allegory of Soviet totalitarianism, where farm animals overthrow their human owner.

Title: Sense and Sensibility
Description: A novel about the Dashwood sisters and their romantic struggles in early 19th-century England.

Title: Tender Is the Night
Description: A novel about the rise and fall of Dick Diver, a promising young psychiatrist, and his wife Nicole.

Title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Description: The third book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry learns more about his past and faces new dangers.
